summary: Gene R. Johnson was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). His name appears on multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from April 1978 to January 1979. These reports list his name, social security number, position, salary, and employment dates within the SCAS. The documents indicate that Johnson was employed by the committee for a significant portion of its operational period.
significance: Gene R. Johnson's significance lies in his employment within the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating his involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination. The payroll records confirm his role as a staff member during the committee's active period.
